content: Continuous treatment tended to be more effective in preventing accepted atrial fibrillation after 2 years of follow-up. This difference can possibly be attributed to more electrical cardioversions in the episodic treatment group and the unwillingness of patients to undergo any more electrical cardioversions. In the continuous treatment group, most patients were taking amiodarone at the time of a recurrence of atrial fibrillation.

title: Continuous vs Episodic Prophylactic Treatment With Amiodarone for the Prevention of Atrial Fibrillation: A Randomized Trial
